page.title: 02The Undercliff_Main features
page.content: The Undercliff is a{unique}area for two particular reasons: 1.Its geological formation as a great terrace between the sea and the inland cliff which shelters it completely from the north and gives rise to its mild climate, fertile soil and remarkable wild life of all kinds. 2.For hundreds of years there was no access to this terrace except at either end(Blackgang and Luccombe) or by the difficult cliff paths. In consequence of this isolation the population remained small,and man's interference with the natural conditions was necessarily limited. Probably also the landslips to which the area is prone discouraged habitation. Niton Undercliff runs from Blackgang to Binnel Point.
